tfmg.ponder.small_engines.text_1: To create a small engine, place the front and back parts adjacent to eachother
tfmg.ponder.small_engines.text_2: Fuel is inputted into the front part, and exhaust must be removed from the back part using pipes and an exhaust block
tfmg.ponder.small_engines.text_3: Applying a redstone signal to the front part starts the engine
tfmg.ponder.small_engines.text_4: Small engines include LPG, kerosene and gasoline engines
tfmg.ponder.diesel_engine.text_1: Diesel Engines are assembled by placing a shaft infront of a Diesel Engine block
tfmg.ponder.diesel_engine.text_2: The engine produces exhaust gas which has to be removed with pipes and an exhaust block
tfmg.ponder.diesel_engine.text_3: Air is needed for the engine to run, so an Air Intake is required
tfmg.ponder.diesel_engine_expansion.text: Diesel Engine Expansions can give a Diesel Engine two new input slots, for lubrication and radiator fluids
tfmg.ponder.surface_scanner.text_1: The Surface Scanner is used to locate crude oil deposits
tfmg.ponder.surface_scanner.text_2: Providing the machine with rotational power makes it scan for the nearest deposit
tfmg.ponder.surface_scanner.text_3: If a deposit is found, the compass will point towards its location
tfmg.ponder.pumpjack.text_1: To start extracting Oil, you must first build a pipeline on top of a deposit using Industrial Pipes
tfmg.ponder.pumpjack.text_2: Then, construct a Pumpjack on top of the pipeline by first placing down a Pumpjack Base...
tfmg.ponder.pumpjack.text_3: Placing the Pumpjack Hammer behind it...
tfmg.ponder.pumpjack.text_4: Next step is building the Connector And the Head of the Pumpjack above the crank and the base
tfmg.ponder.pumpjack.text_5: Now they need to be connected with Pumpjack Pammer Parts, keep in mind that superglue is needed to finish the structure
tfmg.ponder.pumpjack.text_6: And finally, placing the Machine Input with a Pumpjack Crank above it, as shown in the scene
tfmg.ponder.distillation_tower.text_1: A sufficiently large Steel Fluid Tank can be turned into a Distillation Tower
tfmg.ponder.distillation_tower.text_2: The tower is assembled by first placing a Steel Distillation Tower Controller next to the tank...
tfmg.ponder.distillation_tower.text_3: And placing up to 6 Distillation Tower Outputs, all connected with Industrial Pipes
tfmg.ponder.distillation_tower.text_4: Blaze Burners are required to run the Distillation Tower. The dial displays current power levels
tfmg.ponder.distillation_tower.text_5: To input Crude Oil, it must be pumped into the controller block
tfmg.ponder.distillation_tower.text_6: Each output block provides one of the Oil byproducts
tfmg.ponder.blast_furnace.text_1: The base of the Blast Furnace is a Blast Furnace Output block
tfmg.ponder.blast_furnace.text_2: To assemble a Blast Furnace, construct a chimney using Fireproof Bricks as shown in the scene
tfmg.ponder.blast_furnace.text_3: The bottom half of the chimney requires to be reinforced
tfmg.ponder.blast_furnace.text_4: Fuel and other items are inserted through the opening at the top
tfmg.ponder.coke_oven.text_1: The Coke Oven is built by placing Coke Oven blocks as shown in the scene, and clicking its side with a wrench
tfmg.ponder.coke_oven.text_2: The process of coking is slow, so it is more efficient to have long arrays of ovens working simultaneously
tfmg.ponder.coke_oven.text_3: Coal can be inputted from any side
tfmg.ponder.coke_oven.text_4: While running, the oven produces Creosote and CO2 which have to be pumped out for it to function
tfmg.ponder.coke_oven.text_5: Once done, Coal Coke will drop out of the opening
tfmg.ponder.casting.text_1: Casting is the process of pouring liquid metal into a Casting Basin using a Casting Spout
tfmg.ponder.casting.text_2: The Casting Basin, obviously, requires a mold to function
tfmg.ponder.radial_engines.text_1: Radial Engines are a special Type of Engine that doesn't require an exhaust block and has a shaft from both sides
tfmg.ponder.radial_engines.text_2: Clicking the Engine from one of its sides will spawn an input slot that can accept fuel and redstone signals
tfmg.ponder.radial_engines.text_3: Regular Radial Engines uses gasoline as fuel
tfmg.ponder.radial_engines.text_4: Engine will start when redstone signal is applied to the input slot or the block itself
tfmg.ponder.radial_engines.text_5: The second variant of a radial is The Large Radial Engine which uses kerosene as fuel
tfmg.ponder.diesel_engine_expansion.head: Expanding Diesel Engines
tfmg.ponder.tag.oil.description: Machines that extract, process or use Crude Oil and its byproducts
tfmg.ponder.tag.metallurgy.description: Machines that produce, process or use Metal and raw materials as such
